title: Buy Signals May Actually Be Sell Signals In Equity Markets
text: We’re reaching a potential inflection point in the market where buy signals may actually be sell signals.

title: US policymakers likely to agree on a $1 trillion stimulus plan: J.P. Morgan
text: Joyce Chang of J.P. Morgan says President Trump's executive orders on relief measures falls short of what is required and U.S. lawmakers will get a stimulus deal done by September, though it will be closer to $1 trillion rather than the $3 trillion that the Democrats have been asking for.

title: Can Mega-Cap Stocks Continue To Dominate Market?
text: The equity markets rallied for the second straight week, carrying the S&P 500 Index to within 1% of the record highs and the NASDAQ to an all-time record high. And it was nice to see other areas besides mega-caps Apple (AAPL), Amazon (AMZN), and Facebook (FB) getting all the attention (and flows).

title: Oil firms on U.S. stimulus hopes, Asian demand recovery
text: Crude oil gained more ground on Tuesday, with prices underpinned by expectations of U.S. stimulus and a rebound in Asian demand as economies reopen.

title: Asian stocks set for cautious start amid renewed U.S.-China tensions
text: Asian stocks were set for a cautious start on Tuesday, following a mixed Wall Street session and as investors eyed stalled U.S. stimulus efforts and worsening strains between Washington and Beijing over Hong Kong.

title: Chinese firms that do not meet U.S. standards to be delisted as of end-2021
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Monday said companies from China and other countries that do not comply with accounting standards will be delisted from U.S. stock exchanges as of the end of 2021.

title: Trump: ‘No reason why' economy can’t grow at 20 percent pace in third quarter
text: President Trump said during a news conference that ‘Nasdaq is setting new records’ and economic recovery.

title: Jim Cramer: Everybody hates the barbell, until days like today
text: "You need to maintain a diversified portfolio, with high quality companies that may be out of favor right now," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Oil companies start to take back crude from U.S. emergency reserve
text: Energy companies have begun taking back millions of barrels of oil from the U.S. government's emergency stockpile after renting storage in the facility to help manage a glut of crude this spring after energy demand collapsed during COVID-19 lockdowns, a Department of Energy website showed on Monday.

title: President abruptly leaves press briefing
text: President Donald Trump exited a press briefing after a Secret Service agent whispered something in his ear.

title: Stock futures flat in overnight trading after Wall Street notches seventh straight day of gains

title: How Modern Monetary Theory and fiscal policy are converging
text: Most economists would argue that the massive new supply of debt securities would have overwhelmed demand and led to lower prices and higher yields.

title: Bridgewater Co-CIO Bob Prince Explains What Investors Should Do in a Zero-Rate World, Part 1
text: Last week, I raised the question that every value investor should be asking themselves: If benchmark interest rates remain near historical lows, and the U.S. Federal Reserve and other global central banks continue to buy up government and corporate debt, how does one determine the appropriate hurdle rate for investment? Unsurprisingly, I am not the only person thinking about this.

title: What to Expect in M&A in the Second Half
text: Daniel Wolf, M&A partner at Kirkland and Ellis, expects the "first pockets" of M&A activity in financials, technology and health care. He speaks with Bloomberg's Ed Hammond on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close.".

title: Dow, S&P 500 up; tech-related shares underperform value
text: The S&P 500 and Dow rose on Monday, as investors rotated into value stocks from heavyweight tech-related names while they awaited news on progress in a fiscal support bill for the country's battered economy.

title: Dollar gains after weeks of losses as investors focus on U.S. aid package
text: The dollar rose on Monday, including against major currencies such as the euro and Swiss franc, as investors focused on the fiscal stimulus plan in the United States and U.S.-China tensions ahead of key trade talks this week.

title: 19% of wealthy investors are sitting on cash: Tiger 21 poll
text: Tiger 21 is a peer-to-peer learning network for high net worth individuals and their last poll shows that members are increasingly sitting in cash.

title: Gold prices end higher Monday as China-U.S. conflict and superlow rates buoy bullion
text: Gold futures settled higher Monday, resuming a strong uptrend for the precious metal after snapping a five-session win streak on Friday, as China imposed fresh sanctions against U.S. officials in apparent retaliation for similar measures against Hong Kong and mainland officials last week.

text: Some segments of the oil, gas and mining industries were hit harder than others, according to data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Nearly 25% of "oil services" jobs have disappeared since January.

title: Stock Market Today: Concerns Arise As US Stimulus In Limbo
text: Stock market futures are mixed heading into Monday’s trading session as investors wait to see how (or if) any stimulus efforts will bear fruit. In todays video, we discuss current investing themes and news, trending stocks and sectors, and what to expect in the week ahead.

title: El-Erian says the biggest threat to stock market rally is wave of corporate bankruptcies

title: What's Next For The U.S. Economy: Jeffery Sachs
text: Economist and best-selling author Jeffrey Sachs says a geopolitical Cold War with China would be a “dreadful mistake.” He explains how globalization will persist as societies and workplaces move online and urges policymakers to come together to tackle issues like climate change. Sachs says the U.S. economy won’t have a “v-shaped” recovery because of he country’s failure to contain the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.
